text: Terty Ivanovich Filippov (Тертий Иванович Филиппов; 5 January 1825 in Rzhev, Tver Governorate, Russian Empire – 12 December 1899 in Saint Petersburg, Russian Empire) was a Russian folklorist, singer, pedagogue, the Honorary member of the Saint Petersburg Academy of Sciences. As a journalist, Filippov contributed mostly to Pogodin's Moskvityanin, Katkov's Russky Vestnik and Russkaya Beseda, the magazine he was a co-founder of. In 1857–1864 Filippov served as a Russian Orthodox Church official. In 1889–1899 he was the Chairman of the Russian State Control committee. He was awarded Serbian Order of Saint Sava and Order of the Cross of Takovo. == References == Category:1825 births Category:1899 deaths Category:People from Rzhev Category:People from Tver Governorate Category:Slavophiles Category:Russian folklorists Category:Russian theologians Category:19th-century Eastern Orthodox theologians Category:19th- century Russian writers Category:19th-century historians Category:Honorary Members of the St Petersburg Academy of Sciences Category:Recipients of the Order of St. Sava Recipients of the Order of the Cross of Takovo Category:Burials at the Isidorovskaya Church of the Alexander Nevsky Lavra
title: Terty Filippov
